question_data.text: The wolf followed them and once he reached the house he began to shout, ‘Little pigs, little pigs let me come in! ‘Or I’ll huff and I’ll puff and I’ll blow your house down!’. ‘Not by the hair on our chinny chin chins!’ the three little pigs shouted back. The wolf huffed and he puffed and he huffed and he puffed but he could not blow the house down! The wolf was really hungry and angry that he hadn’t gobbled up any little pigs yet. He decided to climb down the chimney instead of blowing down the house! Word Wizard,
question_data.question: Why do you think the wolf decided to climb down the chimney instead of huffing and puffing more?

question_data.text: lived happily ever after. Word Wizard, Online Resources, Senior Infants © 2017 Gill Education
question_data.question: How does the happy ending connect to the book's resources for learning?

question_data.text: The wolf followed them and once he reached the house he began to shout, ‘Little pigs, little pigs let me come in! ‘Or I’ll huff and I’ll puff and I’ll blow your house down!’. ‘Not by the hair on our chinny chin chins!’ the three little pigs shouted back. The wolf huffed and he puffed and he huffed and he puffed but he could not blow the house down! The wolf was really hungry and angry that he hadn’t gobbled up any little pigs yet. He decided to climb down the chimney instead of blowing down the house! Word Wizard,
question_data.question: How might the pigs have felt when the wolf couldn't blow their house down?

question_data.text: lived happily ever after. Word Wizard, Online Resources, Senior Infants © 2017 Gill Education
question_data.question: What happens at the end of the story?

question_data.text: Suddenly, the big bad wolf came upon the first little pig’s house. He knocked on the door. ‘Little pig, little pig, let me come in! Or I’ll huff and I’ll puff and I’ll blow your house down!’ called the wolf. The little pig felt safe in his house so he shouted back, ‘Not by the hair on my chinny chin chin!’. So the wolf huffed and he puffed and he blew the house down. The little pig escaped and ran to his brother’s house of sticks. Word Wizard, Online Resources, Senior Infants © 2017 Gill Education
question_data.question: Why do you think the little pig said 'Not by the hair on my chinny chin chin'?
What does the circle with a C inside mean?

question_data.text: Suddenly, the big bad wolf came upon the first little pig’s house. He knocked on the door. ‘Little pig, little pig, let me come in! Or I’ll huff and I’ll puff and I’ll blow your house down!’ called the wolf. The little pig felt safe in his house so he shouted back, ‘Not by the hair on my chinny chin chin!’. So the wolf huffed and he puffed and he blew the house down. The little pig escaped and ran to his brother’s house of sticks. Word Wizard, Online Resources, Senior Infants © 2017 Gill Education
question_data.question: How might the little pig have felt when the wolf blew his house down?

question_data.text: The Three Little Pigs Once upon a time, three little pigs left their mother and their home in order to seek their own fortunes and to build their own houses. Word Wizard, Online Resources, Senior Infants © 2017 Gill Education
question_data.question: What do you think the pigs will do with their fortunes?

question_data.text: The wolf followed – excited that he might get to eat two little pigs. ‘Little pigs, little pigs let me come in!’, he called, ‘or I’ll huff and I’ll puff and I’ll blow your house down!’ ‘Not by the hair on our chinny chin chins!’, the two little pigs called back. The wolf huffed and he puffed and he blew the house down. The two little pigs raced to their brother’s house of bricks. Word Wizard, Online Resources, Senior Infants © 2017 Gill Education
question_data.question: How might the pigs have felt when the wolf blew their house down, and why?

question_data.text: the chimney instead of blowing down the house! Word Wizard, Online Resources, Senior Infants © 2017 Gill Education
question_data.question: Why do you think it went down the chimney?
